snippet: The problem is visible from the Sierra Nevada to the farmlands in the southern part of the state, and it threatens to cause major hardship.
abstract: Water shortage has residents of California, which is suffering from record drought, trying to deal with problems that usually arise in midsummer, and is affecting vast sectors of the economy; sense of dread is building among farmers, many whom have already let fields go fallow, and cattle ranchers have had to rely on bought hay or reduce their herds.

byline.original: By NORIMITSU ONISHI and MALIA WOLLAN
byline.contributor: Norimitsu Onishi reported from Norden, and Malia Wollan from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The problem is visible from the Sierra Nevada to the farmlands in the southern part of the state, and it threatens to cause major hardship.

headline.main: Severe Drought Grows Worse in California
headline.print_headline: California Watches Bad Drought Grow Worse
